abstract.p: New York Rangers new president and general manager Glen Sather awaits decision by Edmonton Oilers head coach Kevin Lowe on whether Lowe will accept head coaching position with Rangers (S)

block.p: Glen Sather, the Rangers' new president and general manager, should know better by Wednesday whether Kevin Lowe will follow him from Edmonton to become the Rangers' head coach.

Lowe is scheduled to meet with the group that owns the Edmonton Oilers on Tuesday. The Oilers want Lowe, their first-year coach this season, to succeed Sather as general manager, but Cal Nichols, the chairman of the 37-man group that owns the team, acknowledged, ''Compensation is definitely an issue.''
Glen Sather, the Rangers' new president and general manager, should know better by Wednesday whether Kevin Lowe will follow him from Edmonton to become the Rangers' head coach.

Lowe is scheduled to meet with the group that owns the Edmonton Oilers on Tuesday. The Oilers want Lowe, their first-year coach this season, to succeed Sather as general manager, but Cal Nichols, the chairman of the 37-man group that owns the team, acknowledged, ''Compensation is definitely an issue.''
Lowe's contract was tied to Sather's. Sather said yesterday that he would not speak to him until he was certain Lowe was contractually free.
Lowe is Sather's first choice by a large margin, but he said yesterday he had begun compiling a list of candidates, including John Paddock of the Rangers' Hartford affiliate.
